snippet: Analysts said a wide range of fuel-efficient models, particularly from Detroit automakers, has helped spur demand and accelerate the industry’s recovery.
abstract: Analysts say a wide range of fuel-efficient vehicles, particularly from Detroit automakers, are spurring demand and accelerating the industry's recovery, even in the face of higher gas prices at the pump; with more options for consumers, and rising gas prices being less of a factor, major automakers report that sales grew 19.9 percent in August; the industry sold 1.28 million vehicles in August, bringing the yearly total to 9.71 million.
lead_paragraph: Analysts said a wide range of fuel-efficient models, particularly from Detroit automakers, has helped spur demand and accelerate the industry’s recovery.

headline.seo: Auto Sales for August Jumped 20%, Despite Rising Price of Gas
headline.main: Gas Prices Rise, but So Do Auto Sales
headline.print_headline: Gas Rises, But So Do Auto Sales

keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
keywords.name: subject
